content.detailedDescription:
While at a 4th of july party, a guest asked what is that in the sky?

we looked up and to everyone astonishment we saw a huge fireball in the sky.

it came out of the north western sky. it change directions a few time then came to a stop. it was easy to see that it had stopped because it was framed by a very large tree. it was a bright orange and yellow color.

it sat there in the sky for a few seconds then shot off with a tremendous burst of speed. it went from that huge fireball to a small point of light 
in the blink of a eye.

it had to be seen by o'hare airport or anyone who had a clear view of the western sky.

i search the news today but their were no official reports???
content.summary: Huge fireball in sky over chicago.

content.detailedDescription:
Took a trip along the delaware river from upper sussex county down to the water gap and on too i80 heading east, stopped as usual at the lookout point/stop just passed the hacketstown exit on i80 east, i've stopped here more times then i can remember always a pleasure over looking the valley and the river cuts into the appalachian mountains/foot hills, i noticed something that looked like  clouds in the distance but hanging low over the wooded area passed hacketstown and asked my girlfriend for her binoculars, when i focused in on the object i noticed that 1) it was not clouds, 2) it was tilted from my view point  left up and right down and it would slowly move like pivoting length wise but never completing a revolution, 3) it seemed to radiate a red/blue and silver color with the red becoming gold every few seconds, there was a light breeze and it never moved away from its position 4) there was no tower or any structure visible below it, it did not seem tethered, and it was over a heavily wooded area, there was a few people at the lookout taking picture with the background of the valley and i did not notice anyone else noticing, except a gentleman looking in the same direction with what looked like decent binoculars in an suv four cars over from where we parked he then rolled up his windows and started talking on a car phone, i continued to watch then i decided to go ask the man in suv and he had left. my girlfriend took a few pictures of object and surrounding area and i had her shoot a couple of shots through one of the binoculars eye pieces. i have pictures and hope to post them a total of 12 and posting the 3 allowed.


regards
content.shape: Cigar,  Cylinder,  Disc,  Oval,  Square,  Rectagular
content.summary: Hovering anomaly.

content.detailedDescription:
July 5th.  approximately 5:40pm, harrison cty texas - outside the city of hallsville.

we were expecting a storm to run through the area, it had not started raining yet and the power went out.

my wife headed outside to watch the storm, as i shut down the computer equipment and turned off backups.

i went out on the front porch which has a fairly good view of the north. we like to watch storms roll in from there.

it was still day light out and the clouds were fairly high and white at this point of the storm.

just after the first or second lightning flash went off i saw something through the trees.

as it moved into view it moved at a steady flat pace just below the clouds. 

it was in view for about 20-25 seconds, long enough for me to grab my wife and run to the other side of the porch for her to see it before it was hidden by trees & clouds. 

i am not an aviation expert but i'll describe what i saw comparing it to common items seen in the area. 

holding my thumb and forefinger out at arm���s length it was about 2 inches long. 

a cessna plane that flies over frequently at a similar distance would be about a 1/4 inch or smaller.

i was able to see it very clearly at first as it was below the clouds and i could see 2-3 lights in back and the same amount up front. i saw the body of the object fairly clearly; it was a pipe or a tube shape.

the angle it was at, i'd expect to see wings or more of the object, but there were none.

it is uncommon to have aircraft fly this low in the area and when they do, it is usually small private jets and cesena type aircraft, all of which can be distinctly heard before being seen. 

this object made no noise and traveled at a speed (once again comparing to a cessna), would be about 4-5 times the speed of a cesena, possibly more. it's very hard to put a size/distance to it. 

as it moved across my line of sight, it entered the lowest parts of the clouds still fairly visible. 

the lights front and rear seemed to pulse, possibly flash, but it could have been because it was going through the translucent clouds. the lights were all white front and rear.

it was traveling west to east approximately 5 miles north of highway 80 and i saw it east of fm 450 travelling toward marshall tx.

the object i saw had 3 maybe 4 lights that appeared to be round, the number of them was not something i was paying attention to at the time. what i was trying to remember is that the space filled with lights was equal front &/or rear was approximately 1/3 the total distance of the object.  at no time did i see any wings, or tail fins, or any other color of lights but white front and rear. 

that is about it, not sure what it was but it was nothing i have ever seen before.

thank you for reading!
content.summary: Tube like object with lights, hallsville, tx.

content.detailedDescription:
While on shift i noticed what i first mistook as a planet or bright star, orange in color.  the object was appx. 20 degrees off horizon, wsw of my location.  minimal, patchy clouds in upper atmosphere, otherwise clear.  temperature in the mid 60's, humidity in the low 30%.
while watching the object through my patrol vehicle windshield i noticed it dimming and assumed it was indeed a planet/star being hidden by a cloud.  i then noted the clouds and their height in relation to the object and realized it appeared below the clouds.  i then examined the object through my binoculars and confirmed it was below the clouds.
the object was orange and shaped like a "torpedo" type light bulb with a vertical orientation.  the base was bright orange and the canopy was a muted orange glow.  my first thought was a hot air balloon so i stepped out of the vehicle for an unobstructed view.  
as i watched the object grew smaller and lost altitued in relation to the horizon, indicating it was moving away rapidly in a wsw direction and still under any clouds in the area.  it continued its course until it was far enough away that i lost sight of it, about 10 degrees above the horizon.
factors surrounding incident:
ancohol - no
drugs - no
photographs or video - unfortunately, no
previous sightings by yours truly - one, over thirty years ago
occupation of yours truly - deputy sheriff
witnesses - yes (see following)
as i typed this my 13 year old daughter informed me she and her friends also saw the object.  she thought it was an "orange hotair balloon" but couldn't be sure as it was "far away".
nice to know i am not losing my marbles.
hmmmmmm.....
content.summary: Orange, glowing, vertical torpedo shape w/canopy less bright than base.

content.detailedDescription:
Well, me and my nephew were at his house, prepping for an evening of stargazing.  we were at the car when we saw a light in the sky.First i dismissed it as a plane.On further inspection, we could not dermine what it was and did not seem to be a plane as it was stationary otherwise and then it was going back and forth.  this was a relatively still night.  no outlines of a plane to be seen.Just this white-bluish light south of us about 400-500 metres up.We were heading to where it was stationary so we decided to follow it.By then it had started to move south, out of town where we were going anyway for stargazing which i do quite frequently and see some strange things.  we managed to follow it for some time not ever really seeing what it was until it stopped above a wooded area, which we then promptly entered.We stopped the car in a little clearing and couldnt see the light object anymore.  we stayed there for awhile and then suddenly this red-orange, flash of light, came from the southeast sky to due north and just disappeard very quickly,lasted only about probably less than a minute i think.It went into the woods, it was very small, like a flare, but not.  i would have thought it a meteor, but a meteor that close as i saw it would have had to had a trail and being so close would have done damage and obviously been visible longer upon inspection.I was stunned at seeing something so close and obviously i tried to go through what it was.If it had been a flare of some sort, there would have been noise, and it would have gonu up or down not sideways.It was not a light bug as there are none in iceland.It was not a meteor or comet as this light was closer than a big meteor could be without destroying a vast area, disappered into the woods.  it was to quick to decide if it was man made or otherwis a constructed object, i can say it was a ball of lightning, which is sort of what it was,however, but they are extremely rare in this country, and would they travel in mid air going downward for a few meters, i dont know.I have so little to compare with. although we do have something called snowmoon that are sort of whispy lights during winter like swamp gas or balls of fire.
note.  i have numerous other accounts in those woods and in that general area, it is close to an airport, where people have seen things come on the radar and then disappear.People have been chased by balls of light in their cars and a few stories here and there from people who have had amazing experiences.  p.S there are 1 thunderstorms in this town every 10 years or so.
content.distance: 20 Feet or Less, 21-100 Feet, Over 1 Mile
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Fireball, orange looking, very fast, similar to meteorite.

content.detailedDescription: While sitting on my deck which faces north with friends we spotted a round object with a amber-red light on the lower front of the craft. the craft was moving at a steady speed but made no noise at all, at first we thought it was a helicopter but no other lights were visible just the one on the nose. the object appeared to be round or oval. the craft was going from the north heading south and which it then made a right turn and began heading west. we were able to watch it for about 30 more seconds and then it never reappeared past some small wispy clouds. my friends and family were all talking about what happened and wondered what we had just seen. 15 to 20 minutes later a second object did the exact same thing. it was almost like watching a rerun of the first sighting except the light on the nose seemed to be pulsing dimmer then brighter. the light was not flashing like a beacon or strobe just going brighter then dimmer. once the craft turned west we were able to watch it for another 15 to 20 seconds until it simply dissappeared.
content.summary: 1 round object  with a light on the front bottom approached from the north turned west and dissappeared.

content.detailedDescription:
I was sitting on the beach and put my sunglasses on, and looked up at the sun.  immediately, i noticed a circular, dim, shadowy sphere - about the same size as the sun, from that distance - moving through the clouds northeast.   i looked around and also saw several airplanes and birds, but none were that high and none looked spherical in nature.  i caught the attention of my friend and tried to get her to see what i was seeing, but she couldn't find what i was looking at.   i followed it through the clouds - for about 30 seconds - and just when the clouds broke and the object should have appeared, it simply was just not visible any longer.  

i was incredibly intrigued and excited, as it was definitely one of those moments that is truly perplexing.  i knew i was seeing something that i've never seen before.
content.summary: Dim, shadowy circle moving through clouds.

content.detailedDescription:
On june 25th 2009 we were driving from colorado to missouri area at 1125pm mountain time.

we were heading east on i-70 in kansas. we were driving a 4 door sedan so we could see all of the way around our vehicle without obstruction.

we just passed mile marker 24. it was a very clear dark night not a cloud in the sky we could see for miles. there were off in the distance maybe a mile or 2 away antenna type (red lights) flashing together continuously in unison. we commented on the red lights and was wondering why so many antenna were in the area.

 while traveling aprox 70 mph heading east bound we witnessed a flash of light to our right near the outside of our car. it seemed to be just above the height of the car off in the distance about 20 feet out from the car behind the passenger head/shoulder area. then another flash light a huge very bright quick led about a foot back farther from the first. then a third flash closer in time  but further in distance toward the rear of the car. (as if it were a old fashioned photo flash bulb.) only very bright and much larger. 

we both looked at each other. i slowed the car. i said did you see that ?She said, i saw the bright light flash 3 times but not at the same time as if it was in a delayed pattern. i agreed.  we decided to pull over on the side of the shoulder to see if we could see anything more.

 i looked behind us and there was not a car in sight for miles but could see an overpass ahead. we pulled over to the shoulder on the right side of the road just past the overpass. we stopped the car and pulled to the side of the road but there was nothing.

we took off back onto the interstate. we were going about 50 miles hour increasing our speed when another bright flash occurred. closer this time almost touching the car hood, in front middle. 

 the light floated to the passenger side of the vehicle almost as if it was hugging or surrounding the car. again it was off the ground above the car approximately at the height of the rear view mirror. the second blink 1 second later a short surge of light was directly even with the car at the passenger window. the third flash again in a later 2 second delay pattern from the first. it was if something was flying like a very large lightening bug only with a very bright led light flash about the size of a volleyball. after each flash it appeared to have a diamond shaped light or a cross formation as it dimmed out. 

we kept driving in disbelief as to what we just saw. we never did see an object. just very bright orb like led lights in 3 sequencial flashes but with a shorter delay between the 2nd 3rd flash. 2 separate times. 

driving at that speed we were just dumb founded as to what it could be. especially after the second incident as it was in front of the car and we were traveling over 50 miles an hour but it seemed to mock our speed and hang in the air right with us. 

we never heard any odd sounds.The witness was in the passenger front side of the car.
content.summary: While driving 2 series of 3 flashes that seemed to follow and hover above our car.

content.detailedDescription: I was watching the neighborhood fireworks in my backyard with my kids and at approxiametely 22:15 i saw an orange orb of light coming from the west side of town. it looked about 1000ft or so in the air and seemed to be floating in an easterly direction. the orange ball of light lasted for about 3 minutes and then disappeared. both of my kids were witnessed this event. then in the east side of town, two more orange orbs of light about the same height appeared in the sky and were headed west and seemed to be floating. at first i thought it was a meteor shower but after seeing 7 of these lights total within an hour, i concluded that they may have been flares but not 100% sure. each time the orange orbs of light disappeared in about 3 to 5 minutes.
content.summary: 4th of july surprise.

content.detailedDescription: While camping yesterday we were watching fireworks around us,i saw what i thought was maybe a glowing ember crossing the sky from north to south. then as it traveled overhead itmore resembled a diamond with a orange and then blueish reflection from inside the diamond. it traveled behind some trees. at first it seemed not too high but after it passed directly overhead i relized it was really a very high altitude. my girlfriend and i were talking about what it could be, another came across the same place but was smaller, as it passed overhead i relized it was at a higher altitude than the first one. we watched the sky for the rest of the night but did not see anything else.
content.summary: Two orange/blue diamonds traveling north to south.

content.detailedDescription: It was a partly cloudly day with wind high up.The clouds were at two levels with the lower level moving from the north to the south .I was at work and just came back from lunch .We were geting ready to make a heavy lift with a crane.I was looking the rigging over when i looked up at the crane hook whitch was hanging in mid air with rigging on it when i saw a black cloud was moving east to west against the wind whitch i thought was very odd.After looking at it for about two minutes i realized that it was a shadow not a cloud then i looked just to my left when i saw an object that was in between the levels of clouds moving east to west against the wind.The object was very very large.It had a mirror finish to it.It was very long with slitly rounded ends.I watched the objsct for about 15 minnutes when i turned my attention back to my work.The object was moving over the albany county airport.I would be very intersted to know if other people reported seeing this object on 5/22/09.
content.summary: Object was like a mirror with a dark outline around it. outlining a tubular shape.

content.detailedDescription:
On june 25th 2009 we were driving from colorado to the st louis, missouri area at 1125pm, mountain time. 

we were heading east on i-70 in kansas. we were driving a 4 door sedan so we could see all of the way around our vehicle without obstruction. 

we just passed mile marker 24. it was a very clear dark night not a cloud in the sky we could see for miles. there were off in the distance several antenna type (red lights) flashing sequentially, continuously in unison. we commented on the red lights and was wondering why so many antenna were in the area. 

 while traveling aprox 70 mph heading east bound we witnessed a flash of light to our right near the outside of our car. it seemed to be just above the height of the car off in the distance about 20 feet out from the car behind the passenger head/shoulder area. then another flash light a huge very bright quick led about a foot back farther from the first. then a third flash closer in time  but further in distance toward the rear of the car. (as if it were a old fashioned photo flash bulb.) only very bright and much larger. 

we both looked at each other. i slowed the car. i said did you see that? she said i saw the bright light flash 3 times but not at the same time, as if it was in a delayed pattern. i agreed.  we decided to pull over on the side of the shoulder to see if we could see anything more. 

 i looked behind us and there was not a car in sight for miles but could see an overpass ahead. we pulled over to the shoulder on the right side of the road just past the overpass. we stopped the car and pulled to the side of the road but there was nothing. 

we took off back onto the interstate. we were going about 50 miles hour increasing our speed when another bright flash occurred. closer this time almost touching the car hood, in front middle. 

 the light floated to the passenger side of the vehicle almost as if it was hugging or surrounding the car. again it was off the ground above the car approximately at the height of the rear view mirror. the second blink 2 seconds later, a short surge of light was directly even with the car at the passenger window. the third flash again in a later 2 second delay pattern from the first. it was if something was flying like a very large lightening bug only with a very bright led light flash about the size of a volleyball. after each flash it appeared to have  a diamond shaped light or a cross formation as it dimmed out.Itseemed to hang over the car. 

we kept driving in disbelief as to what we just saw. we never did see an object. just very bright orb like led lights in 3 sequential flashes but with a quicker delay between the 2nd & 3rd flash. 2 separate times. driving at that speed we were just dumb founded as to what it could be. especially after the second incident as it was in front of the car and we were traveling over 50 miles an hour but it seemed to mock our speed and hang in the air right with us. we never heard any odd sounds.
content.summary: A series of 3 flashes two separate times while driving down i-70 seemed to follow our car.

content.detailedDescription: Prior to east county fireworks 3 red lights in a triangle with a fourth to the east same kind of event that took place in late feb early march not flares the lights moved with a contolled motion
content.summary: 4 red lights.

content.detailedDescription:
My brother in law and i saw stragne red x light pattern in he eastern sky of new brighton, pa as we sat around a camp fire in my backyard. the shape never flashed or blinked and moved from east to west for approxiamately four to five minuets. i held my thumb up to the object and it was between 1/4 and 1/2 the size of my thumnail. i eastimated the object to be at least a mile high in the air. due to the fact that it seemed to be above the sparce cloud cover. the red light just faded out of view after the four or five minuet time frame that we were able to observe it. i have been interested in ufo's for a long time and regurlay scan the sky looking for strange things. this is the 1st time that i ever saw anything that i could not identify, the shape did not look or act like any know plane or helicopter or other aviation ship that i am familar with. we both felt like we were viewing something very strange in the sky and we were both convinced that we were viewing something unknown to either of us.

jason b.
content.summary: Strange red x shape in the sky.

content.detailedDescription: While sitting outside on the night of the 4th, i turned to my left and noticed an object in the sky moving slowly from west to east.  the object was about 1/4" at arms length and was reddish orange.  there was no tail and no sound.  the object went from a bright glow, dimming to extinguished.  the event lasted approximately 30 seconds and was also seen by my wife.
content.summary: Orange fireball moving west to east.

content.detailedDescription:
Both myself and another person saw the bright white sphere hovering above area of fireworks. it hung in one place for 30 secs and then moved across sky away from that place at a speed a  little faster than a satellite moves. then it moved bavk toward original area momentsrily and back and forth like this 4 or 5 times before shooting off skyward and away.

it was a little brighter than a background star above it but larger in diameter.

my initial momentary thought was that it was asatellite but then it maneuvered and i knew it wasn't.


we both were watching the object  and in awe.  needless to say, the fireworks themselves held iftle fascination after that.
content.summary: White globe-like object hovered over fireworks.

content.detailedDescription: My mother and i were sitting on the back patio. which is secluded because the house sits up on a bluff surrounded by trees. the way the house is situated on the property, as well the location of the property it is statistically improbable this was the result of fireworks. we live by mcchord afb and ft. lewis and they had festivities on base so no night flight activities there. our house is also on the approach to seatac airport (south to north)however yesterday they were on the north,south approach. moon rise had not occurred as of yet either. ok, now that i have tried to dispel the usual suspects let's get to the story. as i was saying. my mother and i were sitting on the back patio when she noticed a red spherical shaped object suddenly appear in the evening sky and move slowly and silently from east to west. this lasted about 1 minute when all of a sudden it flashed real bright stopped changed from east to west to a southwesterly slight climbing in altitude direction it flashed two more times very quickly not as luminous and just disappeared. ok, i am thinking this could have been a meteor skimming across the atmosphere before bouncing off into space. well i would have been fine and dandy with that explanation, until not even a minute later it reappeared in the same position doing exactly the same motions, except varying speed then coming to a complete stop. it flashed brightly and then changed direction climbing in altitude and heading due south. it flashed two more times although not as intensely bright then just disappeared. the whole duration lasted five minutes. from 21:59 to 22:04 pdt. i thought that was pretty fricken awesome, it was what happened afterwards that has me thinking this baby wasn't from anything we manufacture. because at 22:06 i saw a low orbiting satellite fly over going from south to north and at 22:08 a second low orbiting satellite flew over heading from west to east. i understand there is a lot of equipment flying around in orbit, and maybe this is just coincidence. but...At 22:16 a low flying aircraft was over the same general area as the ufo not a normal flight pattern and this was a jet. still coincidental? at 22:26 another jet this one smaller and older because the engines were louder not fighter more like an old 727. flew over the same general vicinity. at 22:28 a third aircraft this one a cessna sized aircraft flew around the same general area this time flying in a circle around the general area before moving on. after that the skies were quiet except for the fireworks in the background. the episode ended at 22:38
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering,Other
content.summary: Ufo fly by.

content.detailedDescription: We were on the shore of glenn cove looking out over the water when i noticed a strange flashing red light in the sky. i have never seen anything that quite resembled it so i told the others to look at it. we watched it and noticed it flashed in sequences of 2 2 2 2 2 then 1 1 1 1 1 and kept repeating this pattern. it looked to be over the larchmont ny area. it moved slowly to the east then back to the west. it did this a few times and at times seemed to be stationary. then it moved slowly to the west until it was out of view. we watched it for about 10 minutes. we couldn't tell the size and shape because it was dark outside. in between the flashings of the red light, which was fairly constant, i could make out a dim white light on the craft.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Hovering flashing red light approximately over larchmont, ny.

content.detailedDescription: the three of us were at a private island (located minutes from the end of anchor bay drive clay mi)  for a event gathering of under 100 people.Red glow of constant color on bottom of flat black angular ufo just under clowds passing just under the moon (distance under moon was the size of the moon) witnessed by mechanical engineering, logistics specialist, peace officer. seen on 07/04/2009 22:24 for 4 min 19 secs. if the moon were 12:00 the red object came out of the horizon at 07:30 then increased altitude steadily with the same speed and heading of direction (reason im not saying north south east or west is i was not familiar with the surroundings). at first glance thought to be red coast guard helicopter, but as it passed under the moon we could see it was creating its own red light. the red light was under the flat black angular ufo.The best description of the red glow like looking at red glowing moliton steel.The reason i use the tearm angular is,i cant explaine the shape of it. ive tried to sketch a drawing but i just cant seem to get it exact. i know what it is not. it was not the international space station because it was on ground side of the clowds. it was not a jet,helicopter,blimp,small air craft because it had no tracker beacon or vapor disturbance. it was not a hot air balloon because it was too fast and entering proximity of no fly zone of selfridge air national guard base. we lost sight of the ufo because of the buildings and tree line elevation. this was real it was unknown and it was in the air.The slang military/airman tearm for this is "rock"=rauc r=real a=airborn u=unknown c=craft.To describe my feelings i would have to say at first jumpy/shaky but within a few minutes after fulfillment/collected. when i got home at 02:44 i could not sleep untill after 06:00 and only slept for 3 or 4 hours. i will agree to the release of my contact information to third parties only if mufon tells me who and what the third party is and where there from and if i agree i will.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering,Other
content.summary: Red glow of constant color on bottom of flat black angular unknown craft just under clowds passing just under the moon witnessed by mechanical engineering logistics specialist peace officer.

content.detailedDescription: This is my third attempt to submit this sighting, everytime i click submit is goes to an invalid page saying i lost my connection. lets start the story. it was 8:42 exactly, my son and i were leaving the house to go to keystone pizza at the corner of our block for a pick up order for 8:45. once we arrived at the corner i noticed this flashing green and red light over the city hall buildings. usually when i come to this corner i can see a large variety of airplanes, some with flashing lights, some with bright flashing lights, bright steady landing lights etc. this was not one of the usually lights i seen. we ran back to the house i grabbed my digital video camera and ran back up to see the lights. they were still flashing green then red, i took video for a few seconds but the zoom couldn't capture the shape, so i tried to move closer and grabbed some more video. i took 4 all together. i noticed the object shift to the left, unfortunately i didn't get this on video, but after it was in the new position, the only light i could see flashing was the red. at this point the object was not moving just staying in that spot, so we proceeded to get our pizza. came back out and crossed to the dollar store for drinks. looked up and object was still there, i grabbed another video and i asked some neighbors and walking pedestrians to acknowledge the light and ask what there opinions were. some said they thought it was part of the building until they realized the object was above the building, someone said it may be a helicopter, but i doubt it, i have seen helicopters and from that distance its noway a helicopter would be as big or as bright. hopefully you can analyze video and figure out what i seen.
content.summary: Ufo sighting over philadelphia center city.

content.detailedDescription: Bright orange flicking fire ball hovering in the western sky, stalling, then became dim then brighter, stalls for a minute ot two then traveling east and then going up and out of sight. 12 people witnessed, very erie, nobody discussd after the episode, until today sunday..
content.summary: Bright orange ball of fire flickering, moving from east to west stopping and starting.

content.detailedDescription: Last night 4th of july just when all the fireworks were going off i walked to the 7-11 at pecos and lake mead bld. on my way back i got a call from my brother and he said to look in the eastern sky there was a glowing object. i saw it heading north over nellis airforce base my brother watched it from hebderson in the south move to the north.I seen it moving slowly for a large object. wich reminded me of a rocket stage seperating when you see the flash.It was orange flaming like a plasma burst oround it that happened a couple of times then it was to far to see anymore.I want you to check the radar in this area it seemed to go right over nellis airforce base maybe more to the east of the base. south to north at that time.I looked at my phone clock it said 9:36 so a few minutes before that.
content.summary: Flaming object moving south to north.

content.detailedDescription:
In chanute, kansas around 11:00 pm on the 4th of july,last night, we had just finished shooting off the last of fireworks and everyone was going inside.  i had steped back out on the porch and noticed to the northeast a firework display a couple of blocks from our house. i stood and watched it, after the firework was done i noticed a flaming orange ball come from the same direction.  at first i thought it was a burning ember from the firework but it just keep coming my direction.  i walked out into the yard and it was still lite up and coming my way.  i really believed it was a burning ember, but the closer it got to me i noticed it looked like an orange fire inside of a clear ball.  it traveled straight past our yard and our house and continued to travel to the south. i watched it for at least 45 seconds continuing on it's course south until i could no longer see it.  i went inside and told my husband what i had just seen.  he walked out with me and we were looking in the sky, a few minues later he asked me if that was what i had seen and to the east we seen another one off in the distance.  i told him yes, that was the color.  we sat in the back yard and continued to watch the sky.  within 20 minutes we seen another two from the north.  every time we would walk toward it to see it better, it would move back to the north.  
we had no storms in the area on the 4th.  i know i have never seen anything like this in my life.  we watched for over an hour and did not see anymore of them. this was no burning ember or firework it stayed lite to long and traveled a very long distance in a straight line, it never went any higher and stayed at the same altitude. when it went by the house it was close enough that i could see a clear ball with an orange fire inside, it made no noise and did not seem like it was very big, but it was diffently bright.
content.summary: Orange light.

content.detailedDescription:
At around 9:20 pm, i was walking passed a large sliding glass door that looks out across my back yard and all the way to the horizon. i saw five very bright objects, relative to the size of bright stars, but brighter, hovering in the air. they appeared to be closer to the horizon than to my house. when i first saw them they were in a zig-zag pattern, like an elongated letter 'm'. i was curious, since i often look at the night sky and this formation did not look familliar, so i went outside to watch them. 
i watched them for more than half an hour. after watching them for a few minutes, i saw them start to move, in different directions. when they started moving, other objetcs appeared. i called my daughter out to look, and a few minutes later my whole family was watching. the objects changed formation while we watched. they formed a triangle, they formed a diamond, they formed a concave semi circle, they split into two groups, they came back to their 'm' pattern. sometimes, other lights appeared (we saw as many as 8 at one time), sometimes they dimmed so that only three were visible. it seemed that when they were moving, they got dimmer, but when they were hovering, they were brighter. a couple of the objects pulsated, and the color of the light quickly changed from white to red to white to red, etc.... 
while viewing these objects, i was awestruck at what i was seeing. i knew they were not stars or planets because of their independent movement from each other. i knew they were not aircraft because of the way they were hovering, motionless. if they were some sort of helicopter, i would have expected to hear them. when it was over, and all the lights dimmed, my skin as covered with goosebumps. we finally lost sight of the objects when some of them just blinked out, and others flew off in different directions and dimmed out. while the objects were dsispersing and dimming out, i heard the sound of an aircraft flying by, but did not see anything.
using a compass, from my porch their position was very close to exact north, maybe a degree or two to the west. i would very much like to speak to an investigator about this sighting.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change
content.summary: 5 to 8 objects, changing formations, hovering, pulsating colors.

content.detailedDescription:
The year was definitely 1964. i was 16. i'm not certain of the month, day, or exact time. i think it was spring or summer. the night of the sighting was pleasant, the night skies were clear and beautiful-cloudless and stary.
my mother had taken our dog out into the front yard. she left the front door open so i heard her through our screen door say, "what the hell is  
that?" i got up and went outside immediately to see what was wrong. my mother pointed to the sky toward the east. at an altitude of about 3000 feet and a distance of about 2 miles,we saw a strange light in the sky- it is difficult to describe because i've never seen anything like it before or since. a moment or so after, my father came outside and saw the object as well. we saw three primary colors of red, green, and yellow surround- 
ing the object. what was particularly strange was that the light had a vaporous, cloudy, luminescent, quality to it-a very eerie sight.We watched the object for what was probably a few minutes-it was not moving-
it just hovered in one spot. my dad told me to "get the binoculars" which i did very quickly. we all took turns looking through the binoculars and 
it was then that i saw a white triangular shape inside the vaporous colors that were described earlier. the triangle shape couldn't be seen with the naked eye.During almost the entire time of the sighting, the object continued to hover almost 20 minutes. i had enough time to knock on neighbors doors and call my best friend who lived about a block away but strangely enough, noone was home. we continued to watch but then an airliner (probably a 707) flew into the airspace of the ufo. the plane was
on its final approach to linberg field in san diego. they must have gotten a really good look at it becasue as the plane decended, it parralleled the altitude of the ufo for a moment. suddenly, and for the first time the ufo moved at tremendous speed into deep space! within 7 seconds the object seemed to disappear into space. it was then that my father who then worked for rohr aircraft on military and commercial aircraft and satillites and even had security clearances for some of the more secret work then being done, said,"well, we've just seen a ufo, we don't have anything that moves like that." this story is absolutely true and i hope you can send a record of this sighting to me -i have never had it verified.  the sighting took place from our home in san diego.
 gregory n.Perna
content.summary: White triangular shaped object surrounded by strange red, green, and yellow  cloudlike light.

content.detailedDescription: My wife, parents and i were in the back yard to watch the spring valley fireworks at 9pm. around 8:45 my mother said that she saw some red lights hovering over el cajon. the rest of us looked and saw 3 lights in a roughly triangular formation hovering high over el cajon. they began to drift slowly south-eastward. i went inside and grabbed a pair of binoculars to look more closely at the lights but they didn't look much clearer though they were of an elongated triangular shape which i've seen before. a fourth light appeared to the east and began to pace the 3 lights, and on top of a nearby hill (dictionary hill) we saw a red flaring light on the top that almost seemed to be signaling the lights. around 9pm, when the fireworks were to start, the triangular lights formed a line, and the middle light faded quickly away. i predicted that the lights would probably be gone by the end of the fireworks display, and sure enough, by 9:15, they were gone. i did a search online this morning, and saw that such red lights have been sighted over el cajon on the 4th of july now every year since at least 2003. i have witnessed 2 other ufo phenomena in or above el cajon in the last 15 years, just for the record.
content.summary: 3 red lights over el cajon, in triangular formation.

content.detailedDescription:
on the night of june 30th 2009 (kingston ontario, 44.2 lat., -76.5 long) myself and my mate were walking our dogs at 12:00 midnight to 12:10. always being interested in the sky and keeping an eye open this night was perfect, clear sky's the moon just partly lit in the south west sky, when i noticed a glint in the southern sky at about 10 o'clock position looking west.

	i have seen lots of sat's give up there location to the setting sun glowing brightly and then going out. i watched this to see where it was going and how long it would last. it then got bigger and i figured i was looking at a plane headlight, but then it got longer so i asked my mate, what do you think of this light. she quickly looked up and we both watched as it got brighter and larger, looked like an hour glass on fire to me, how far off, no idea but it seemed a great distance, then after about 15 seconds it went out, just sort of a grey outline in the sky, so i thought wow that was some light show. it must be huge to look that bright down here and still be seen as an outline (looked to me like a bus flying through space, from where i stood) i thought, spacestation but it travels west to east i thought not south to north, i did assume thats what i must be seeing.. 

	then i noticed that there was a red light on the object. i thought, what in orbit would have a red light on it that i could see from here? then i noticed the red light was moving. it traveled a circular pattern as it it was mounted on the outside and was going around something. the object could not be seen, it was as if it was invisible, but the red light gave it away, it took about 5 seconds for the light to do one revolution (counter clockwise), i watched 3, 4 revolutions as the object was directly over head moving towards the north. no sound, nothing, just then i noticed, it was glowing on the top, i could not see the top but the air above it was lite up like the color of a sunset, pink, orange, red, i mentioned, look it's glowing at the back on top, just then a small orb came off of the larger object, this orb looked like an ember from a hot fire, about the size of a star, and just as bright. it made several loops behind the object (like an ember in the wind) , seemed to follow, but i watched the larger object due to the fact that if you took your eye away you could probably not locate it again, the object continued to the north with the light rotating. 

	the red light was the red of a tail light in a car or a jet, how fast would it have to have been going to go from sunlight to over my head in 25 seconds, then to the north and back out of sight in another 35 seconds? the circular path the light took was very large, i would say that if you held out a 5 inch disk at arms length it's about the size of the light path when the object was overhead. the whole event lasted about 50 seconds or so. i have never seen anything like this and i am in my 45th year here on earth. i will try to get my mate to submit what she saw. 

	never stop looking up you never know what you'll see ! james in kingston.
content.summary: Circulating red light on silent craft.

content.detailedDescription: Probably not alien life, but definitely and unidentified flying object. i live in el cajon, the east county part of san diego. last night was the 4th of july, so around 8:30 i went to this tiny church on a hill, it's where my friends and i go to just sit around basically, and there's a great view of san diego from the spot. so we were up there waiting for fireworks and at about eight forty five one of us noticed three really bright red "dots" in the sky. they were flickering, not like a plane would but not like stars either, simply getting brighter and dimmer and brighter and dimmer. they simply sat in the sky for a minute or two, then started slowly moving, went directly over our heads, and eventually formed a very distinct triangle in front of us. then after about fifteen minutes they seemed to disperse from each other again and headed in a different direction. they moved slowly, about the speed they would go if they were drifting with wind currents, but they were moving with purpose. they moved away from us and got dimmer but were definitely still there. i'd guess that there was probably a light on one side of the object, and it rotated the light away from us making it seem duller. anyway, as they moved away, a fourth red object rose into our sights (it was blocked by the church until that point), and this one was as bright as the other three had originally been which makes me think that it had the light facing towards us? a few of my friends said that they saw one of the objects "drop" something dark, but i didn't see this.. a few also said that it looked like there was something "behind" the red lights, but i wear contacts which hinders my ability to pick out things like that. i ended up going home about when the 4th light came, which was probably around 9:15. i googled the red lights, and it seems like people have seen something very similar to them on the 4th of july in 2007 and 2008. so maybe they are some kind of government aircraft out there to regulate fireworks? i really don't know, i just know that these were not any kind of planes or flying object i had ever seen before.
content.summary: Three flashing red dots stayed formed triangle and stayed in sky for over an hour; 4th joined eventually.

content.detailedDescription: I was walking through a suburban neighborhood at mid-morning when i saw in the sky what i at first took for a hawk, although its coloring did not match any raptors that live in this part of the world. it had a white body and black wings. it was circling in the sky in the manner of a hunting raptor, but as i watched i realized that it was made of metal, as it flashed each time it reached the easternmost point of its circle, closest to the sun, which was still in its rising arc. as it reached the westernmost part of its circle, it would fade partially from view. it remained circling in the same spot for around five minutes, until i reached a vantage point from which i would be able to view it better, at which point it ceased to circle, flew off towards the northwest, and vanished. while i was watching i was very excited and curious and happy that i was having a mysterious experience, but after the object vanished i felt frightened when i realized i had seen something i was at a complete loss to explain.
content.summary: Metal object circling in sky.

content.detailedDescription: Earlier in the evening, around 11pm on july 4th, i witnessed what may have been a ufo low in the south sky, amidst the fireworks.  then, hours later, at apx. 4:20am the same night (july 5th), i stepped outside in the back yard to let the dog out.  while i waited, i gazed up into the northern sky.  i immediately spotted a moving white object coming from the west and traveling east.  it was not directly overhead, but apx. 80 degrees up from horizon.  initially, i thought it was an airplane at cruising altitude, and what i was seeing was its "headlight".  but when it passed the "approach" threshold from my vantage point and was moving away, i did not see the usual strobe lights of an airplane.  just the same steady white light.  as it faded into the distance, i thought i saw it take on a slightly pinkish-white hue.  hard to tell since by this time, it was barely visible.
content.summary: Solid white ball, medium star-like in size, non-pulsating, steady. apx. 80 degrees high in sky, came from the west, traveling east, steady speed and path. no "airplane strobe lights."
